title: graphX
description: a simple graph theory library for python. Designed to be used with as little pain and confusion as possible. Powered by AlgorithmX. Spiritual successor to Pynode.

title: Microtext
description: a library of small (and probably inefficient) utility functions for messing with text.

title: MathSender
description: a tool designed to help teachers ask maths questions to students during online learning. MathSender provides a way to send beautiful LaTeX based expressions in real time via a question and answer system.

title: StacksUI
description: a UI layout library for the web that uses the paradigm of stacks. Inspired by SwiftUI.

title: ERDot
description: a python CLI script to create Entity Relationship Diagrams from JSON code.

title: Wordwang
description: a language-agnostic word-based esoteric programming language based off Wang's B-machine.

title: JMSS time updated
description: an update to the jmss timetable site, it now supports the new timetable introduced in 2020, as well as letting users set custom images to use as the background.

title: Leven
description: a simple tweening library to make small animations for python.

title: 11Photo
description: a static site generator for making photo essays.

title: Svelte-emoji-picker
description: a simple "emoji picker" component for svelte.

title: Is my browser IE?
description: a website that answers the question, "is my browser Internet Explorer?".

title: Sun weather app
description: a progressive web app that tells you the weather, using the darksky api and jquery.

title: Pico-8 weather
description: a weather app in pico-8, a fantasy console that cannot connect to the internet easily.

title: Zekemagic.com
description: the online homepage of award winning melbourne based magician Zeke Butterworth. On which it is possible to contact him about performing at your event.

title: JMSS Murder
description: a fun real life battle royale style game, in which participants had to poke each other with plastic spoons. Created & run at John Monash Science School in 2019.

title: Darcylf.me
description: the website that you are currently on. It was built using gatsbyjs, react & github pages.
